qas.question: What was territorial revision considered in southeastern Germany?
What road is the border between the French and American zones?
Which article did not allow the division of territory comprising Baden?
What goes into effect if an agreement under article 29 is reached?
Which state did not agree, so was not included in the December 1951 referendum?

context: In southwestern Germany, territorial revision seemed to be <b0_0>a top priority<b0_0/> since the border between the French and American occupation zones was set along the <b1_0>Autobahn<b1_0/> Karlsruhe-Stuttgart-Ulm (today the A8). <b2_0>Article 118<b2_0/> stated "The division of the territory comprising Baden, Württemberg-Baden and Württemberg-Hohenzollern into Länder may be revised, without regard to the provisions of Article 29, by agreement between the Länder concerned. If no agreement is reached, the revision shall be effected by a <b3_0>federal law<b3_0/>, which shall provide for an advisory referendum." Since no agreement was reached, a referendum was held on 9 December 1951 in four different voting districts, three of which approved the merger (<b4_0>South Baden<b4_0/> refused but was overruled as the result of total votes was decisive). On 25 April 1952, the three former states merged to form Baden-Württemberg.
